## Client-Side Shiny App

This Shiny app runs entirely in the browser via [Shinylive](https://shinylive.io/) -- no server required. Use the sliders to explore how parameters affect the normal distribution.

<hr class="section-divider">

<div class="card">
<div class="card-header">Normal Distribution Explorer</div>
<div class="card-body">

```{shinylive-r}
#| standalone: true
#| viewerHeight: 500

library(shiny)

ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("Normal Distribution Explorer"),
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      sliderInput("n", "Number of observations:", min = 50, max = 1000, value = 200),
      sliderInput("mean", "Mean:", min = -5, max = 5, value = 0, step = 0.5),
      sliderInput("sd", "Standard deviation:", min = 0.5, max = 5, value = 1, step = 0.5)
    ),
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("histogram")
    )
  )
)

server <- function(input, output) {
  output$histogram <- renderPlot({
    data <- rnorm(input$n, mean = input$mean, sd = input$sd)
    hist(data, breaks = 30, col = "steelblue", border = "white",
         main = paste("n =", input$n, " mean =", input$mean, " sd =", input$sd),
         xlab = "Value")
  })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)
```

</div>
</div>

::: {.try-it}
#### Try It Yourself
- Set the standard deviation to `0.5` and the number of observations to `1000`. How does the histogram shape compare to sd = `5`?
- Move the mean slider and watch how the entire distribution shifts along the x-axis.
:::
